explains: n. 党派性；党派偏见；对党派的忠诚

sentences.en: His politics were based on loyal partisanship.
sentences.cn: 他的政纲建立在铁杆追随者支持的基础之上。

sentences.en: But the Games transcended that partisanship.
sentences.cn: 但是比赛却超越了政见的分歧。

sentences.en: Their hypothesis is that crowd size and partisanship impose pressures on referees.
sentences.cn: 他们的假设是观众的规模和倾向性会给裁判施加压力。
